div.span: Our School > High School > Northome High School > School Closure

div.p:
Greetings 7th-12th Graders--
I wanted to write and remind all of our 7th-12th graders that although we are at home during this time, the expectation is that each student at Northome is receiving an education through our Distance Learning Program. The Northome teachers have been instructed to reach out to students via email, phone, text message, Google Hangout Chat etc...and for the most part this has been going well. However, we do have a few students that have not been connecting with teachers and this represents a challenge for our Distance Learning Program. So in a nutshell, students will not pass their 4th Qtr class if a teacher has not heard from you and if your coursework is not being completed. This is very important and could impact your graduation status!! My expectation for students that have not connected with their teachers within the last week, would be to please do so immediately. Again, you can do this through email, a phone call, text message, Google Chat etc...If you have questions and are unable to connect with your teacher(s) please call Mr. Tammi at 218-897-5275 Ext 155 or you can respond to this email and I will do my best to help you out. Thanks for taking the time to read this and enjoy the rest of your day.
Mr. Tammi
The Mustang Express is still being published online. Check out the last two issues on the school website. Go to the link on The Northome School homepage.

There will be no food deliveries and daycare supervision on Friday, April 10th and Monday, April 13th. These are marked as No School days on the Northome school calendar. Daycare and Food deliveries will resume on Tuesday, April 14th after Easter break. Also, Northome staff will pick up school work Thursday, April 9. In an effort to limit hand to hand contact, please make sure any returned school work is in a cooler or bin so that it can be safely picked up by our staff. Thanks for your understanding and help with this matter. Have a great day!

a.title: Please provide a cooler or bin for work and meals

h3.a: Please provide a cooler or bin for work and meals

a.title: Please provide a cooler or bin for work and meals
Please provide a cooler or bin for work and meals

div.p: This morning we started our Monday school work deliveries. Please provide a cooler or a bin that we can use to drop off the work, along with your breakfast and lunch. If you have a wet and sloppy driveway, you can place the cooler at the end of the driveway and this will prevent our school vehicles from tearing up your road. Again, we will deliver school work on Mondays and pick up work on Thursdays. Our staff have been told not to pick up any materials on days other than Thursdays. Thanks for your help and understanding with this process.

span.span: If you would like to check out a book from Northome library (the one in town) call Pat DeVries at the Shining Light Café 897-9786 or stick your head in the door and yell Pat. She will assist you in checking out your books. Our volunteer library is IMPORTANT to our community at this time. Thank you

div.p: Northome school has delivered over 750 meals to our students and community families over the past week. Many thanks to everyone that pitched in to support this effort. On Monday, we will still provide meals for everyone that has signed up. Our staff will take the upmost safety precautions while prepping, packing and delivering the meals. We will also begin delivering school materials to students if they have been in contact with their teacher. Please provide a dry container outside of your residence so our staff can securely place the learning materials in it. I would also like to direct our families to take a look at the Northome School Website for each teacher’s individualized distance learning plan. If you have questions regarding the distance learning plan, please feel free to contact the teacher directly with their contact information provided in the learning plan. As always, feel free to contact Principal Tammi at 218-897-5275 Ext 155 if you have any questions, comments or concerns. Thanks for listening and enjoy your weekend.

a.title: Stay at Home order from Governor Walz

h3.a: Stay at Home order from Governor Walz

a.title: Stay at Home order from Governor Walz
Stay at Home order from Governor Walz

div.p: Over the past two days, Northome School has delivered 276 bags of food, 1104 cartons of milk and 552 containers of juice to our students and children around our community. It takes a strong and well organized team to manage this task and I want to thank everyone involved from our kitchen staff to our teachers, paras and our drivers. We will continue to provide this delivery service five days a week to help assist our students and families during this challenging time. We will also start dropping off school work on Mondays and have a pick up date each Thursday for materials that need to be returned to school. Again, Northome School will drop off work on Monday’s and pick up work on Thursdays. Classroom teachers will let families know when to expect work to be dropped off and when the teacher would like it returned. We will also have a drop box in our front entry that families can drop off books, school assignments during the regular school day five days a week. If you have questions, please contact principal Jeremy Tammi at 218-897-5275 ext. 155—Thanks and have a great day!

a.title: March 21, 2020 Letter to staff, students, and parents
